taxon_name.authority: de Candolle in A. P. de Candolle and A. L. P. P. de Candolle
de Candolle in A. P. de Candolle and A. L. P. P. de Candolle

taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family asteraceae;tribe heliantheae;subtribe madiinae;genus hemizonia;species congesta;subspecies tracyi

taxon_name.authority: (Babcock & H. M. Hall) D. D. Keck

bio:treatment.description: Leaves usually puberulent, hispid-ulous, or strigillose and often eglandular throughout, distal rarely villous and glandular. Heads in paniculiform arrays. Peduncles 0 or 1–18 mm, bracts not surpassing phyllaries. Calyculi 0. Phyllaries 3–10.5 mm, apices usually slightly shorter than bodies. Ray florets 5–8(–13); laminae white, not purple-veined. Cypsela widths 0.5–0.63 times lengths. 2n = 28.
Grassy slopes, valleys, stream banks, openings in woodlands, forests, or chaparral;
bio:treatment.discussion: Subspecies tracyi occurs in the north and central North Coast Ranges and on the outer North Coast.
